security: The document details the personal lives, habits, and potential vulnerabilities of Jesus CRUZ Gonzalez and his wife, Mercedes MARTINEZ Moreno, along with information about their family members, daily routines, and political leanings. Releasing these details could compromise ongoing intelligence operations and damage the privacy of the individuals involved. For instance, specific details about their financial situation, personal habits, and Cuban maid's circumstances (e.g., her complaints and vulnerabilities) are included.  Quoting, 'However, since the maid almost never leaves the apartment and she is virtually inaccessible, the Station has been unsuccessful in having any asset establish any degree of rapport with her...' and, 'Cruz almost always returns to the Embassy after a late lunch to work. He apparently works late at the Embassy.'
summary: A CIA dispatch from Mexico City provides an updated target study on Jesus CRUZ Gonzalez, a Cuban Press Attache, and his wife, Mercedes MARTINEZ Moreno, assessing their accessibility for intelligence purposes and their potential vulnerabilities.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET dispatch, sent from the Chief of Station in Mexico City to the Western Hemisphere Division and WH/Miami in December 1970, forwards an updated target study on Jesus CRUZ Gonzalez and his wife, Mercedes MARTINEZ Moreno, who works as the Secretary to the Ambassador. The study assesses CRUZâ€™s accessibility and suitability for intelligence operations, concluding that despite his busy schedule and overt activities, he has limited time for covert assignments. The dispatch details their daily routines, contacts, and background information, including their family's anti-Castro sentiments and potential vulnerabilities, while also noting the challenges in finding suitable access agents or leveraging their Cuban maid for intelligence gathering. The station ultimately decides against prioritizing CRUZ as a target unless recruitment efforts of another individual prove successful.
title: D Target Study: Jesus CRUZ Gonzalez
